name: Union of Ireland with Great Britain
engraver: J. G. Hancock and P. Kempson
obverse: Britannia and Hibernia, the latter holding an olive branch. Both are holding a bundle of rods. Behind them is a pyramid.
reverse: The British Lion reclining on an anchor. To the side of the lion are shamrocks and oak. Above is an open book inscribed with 'ONE LAW'.
reverse_inscriptions: GREAT BRITAIN AND IRELAND UNITED MDCCC
description: The Act of Unification was passed in the British Parliament on July 2, 1800.
